website_summaries.verdict: Effectively filters and improves water for a decent price, but it has some flaws.
pros: Its 5-stage filtering system significantly improves water taste and removes odors
Faucet has a sleek chrome design
cons: Filters may not last as long as desired
some complaints that water odor returns after several weeks
May leak and/or reduce water pressure

website_summaries.verdict: We were hard-pressed to find any negative comments about this product from consumers. An excellent filtration system for a decent price.
pros: Overall cost is one cent per bottle of purified water
cons: Does not re-introduce lost minerals as the Tap Master does

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Quality
customer_reviews.text: The water quality was noticeably better after the install. I definitely recommend this apec water system, the filters last a long time and the installation was very simple. I definitely recommend it for the clean water taste and avoid any particles or contaminated water due to old pipes and tainted water supplies.
customer_reviews.author: veritech_13Top Contributor: Boxing

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: It does take a little time to setup and have everything where and how you want it. But I use this everyday and love it. My pets now only drink purified water and they both actually lost a few pounds and are very active. I also make my own ice and in the picture the one on the left is tap water and the right is the purified water. I am very happy with this unit. Do your own research on restoring good minerals back into the water though, I am still working on that.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Good Instruction, Easy DIY installation
customer_reviews.text: We did quite a bit of research when it came time to replace our existing R/O system and decided on the ROES50. Price was reasonable, well packaged, excellent installation instructions. I like the high faucet...great for filling pots etc. We had to use a booster pump with the previous R/O system but it appears we will no longer need that accessory with the ROES50. Great peace of mind knowing you are drinking purified water. Most people don't give much thought to what's in the water they drink but everyone should.
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Install Instructions are well done
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased three of these units over the past year or so. One for our home, another for my Mom and Dad and another for my daughter and family who just moved into their new home. All installs went well. Directions are well written and easy to follow. Highly recommend this product, it you are looking.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: DIY Friendly
customer_reviews.text: It's been over a year now since I installed this under the kitchen counter and still working well on well water. I'm saving quite a few pennies by refilling my Aqua Fina bottles which was getting a bit expensive. No leaks, tank holds quite a bit of filtered water which it shares with the ice maker. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend it, BTW, my wifes best friend boasted about how she had hers installed (some other brand) and it cost her only 800.00 bucks. LoL
customer_reviews.author: John Linan

customer_reviews.title: Best value, best investment, best water ever!
customer_reviews.text: This system was easy to install, appeared very durable and well made, and best of all it changed the water from a TDS reading of 983 to 25 to 30!! Our feedstock water is from a very deep well, and of good quality (except for the TDS, mostly salts). The prefilters lasted a year before changing, and replacement filters are both affordable and easy to change. This system does a better job than the much more expensive system used by relatives on the same well, I very highly recommend this system!
customer_reviews.author: Illinois guy

customer_reviews.title: Just installed our 2nd APEC
customer_reviews.text: We love these very reasonably-priced units that work great! We just installed our second unit in our bathroom where we take our medications. (Wish we did it 4 years ago!) Our first unit was installed in the kitchen which worked flawlessly for 4 years. Finally replaced the tank for a few bucks and no hassle. The R/O filter is going strong! Why pay more? We tested the ppm dissolved solids (bought a tester) compared to our non-purified faucet water and it brought it from over 200 to 18 ppm. Filters are easy to replace and water tastes wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: ElenaHS

customer_reviews.title: One of the canisters cracked flooding my entire first floor
customer_reviews.text: I came home from work with my floor flooded. Hardwood floor ruined. Baseboard turned to mush. Wallboard ruined. Lots of damage. It took a month to repair and total damage was above $75,000. Fortunately my homeowners insurance took care of everything above my $2,500 deductible. The insurance company called in an expert who determined that the cause of the water damage was due to a leak in one of the RO canisters. They filed a claim with the manufacturer but I don't know if they were ever paid. All I can say is NEVER AGAIN. We now use pitcher based water filters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It needs to better designed
customer_reviews.text: It is nice use and the flavor is good. The installation part is hard. I would rather the pipes are not all around. I know couple other brands has it like a box. This all around and you have to put it together. It could be better design.
customer_reviews.author: Ilkr Phydone

customer_reviews.title: Is Reverse Osmosis for You?
customer_reviews.text: Reverse Osmosis systems waste a lot of water to produce the final product. If you don't mind wasting 4 gallons of water for every gallon of drinking water, then this system is for you. On the other hand, if just ordinary filters will do the job, I would recommend a regular filtration system. APEC does have a regular filter kit that is less expensive than this one. I do recommend this kit for Reverse Osmosis. It is well built, easy to install and not expensive. Just don't place the holding tank higher than the rest of the system as this will cause even more water to be wasted in the filtering process.
customer_reviews.author: Poe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent RO filter, even if your water is already pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This filter works well, is relatively easy to install, and is inexpensive. The replacement filters are not terribly expensive either. This is the second one that I've had. I installed one at my previous home, moved, and then bought another for my new home. The water out of it tastes great, or should I say, tastes like nothing, which is what I want from my water. My local water supply is pretty safe, but you never know what might happen during something like a flood or natural disaster. I also use it specifically for my baby's formula bottles and sippy cup.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, housing failed, great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install, worked great for about 2 years. Filters were easy to replace. Nothing beats R/O water. A little after 2 years the 3rd stage housing ruptured. Fortunately I was nearby and stopped the leak. I'm not sure what caused the rupture - high water pressure, a faulty piece of plastic, or a bad install job. APEC service after the fact was great.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K. Kehrer

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting water. Not easy install!
customer_reviews.text: Our water tastes great. Filter replacement is affordable and the peace of mind about water quality is priceless. But... this is not an easy install for average person. After reading instructions we decided to have a plumber install system. It took him 60 minutes having all the needed tools etc. Totally worth $100 fee. You may want to figure in that cost with cost of product if you’re not “handy”. We’re so happy to have good quality water!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strange taste from the included faucet
customer_reviews.text: The water coming out of the included faucet tastes like the smell of automotive grease unless you let the water run for 10 seconds first. I have a tee going to the refrigerator that does not have a filter and that water tastes fine, so I'm guessing it's coming from the included faucet. This is my second one of these and the other one was fine, including the water out of the faucet. Otherwise a great value with good quality water.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Changed in a matter of 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This went from being awesome to a big headache, water flow changed from decent to literally trickles, do I need to change filters every 2 months or do you have to add a booster pump and get more fancy, either way not worth all the extra expenses and headache, 180.00 dollars down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: kamran

customer_reviews.title: Slippery residues formed in humidifiers by using the RO water
customer_reviews.text: I used the APEC ROES-50 for more than 3 years. I live in southern Nevada. I used the RO water for the humidifiers in my house. After refilled the humidifiers for 2-3 times, I observed obvious slippery residues sticking to the inner surfaces of the humidifiers. If the inner surfaces are reachable by hand, I can wipe them off with a Kleenex paper. I tested the RO water with a TDS meter, the reading was ~22. No one has posted this comment before. It is hard to believe that I am the only person who observed the slippery residues formed in the humidifiers by using the RO water!
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: From nasty well water to great drinking water
customer_reviews.text: We've had this reverse osmosis system for three years now. We've had to replace the filters numerous times ( the first there filters every three months, the final two filters once). We have really awful well water, with about 500 ppm total dissolved solids. It's fine for washing, but it's not fun to drink. The water combing out of this RO filter had about 3 ppm tds, and tastes great. It's all we use for drinking and cooking. The filter had been perfectly reliable, and it sure beats lugging water from the store.
customer_reviews.author: A. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Water tastes like nothing, which actually took some getting used to. I'm a very average homeowner who knows nothing about plumbing and it took me a couple hours to install. The instructions were pretty straightforward, but my exact sink configuration wasn't covered in the instructions, so some of the process was more difficult than it would have been. Heads up, you have to drill into your drain pipe. The filters last a very long time (they're saying to swap the first ones out after a full year). Overall great product as long as you have someone comfortable with installing it. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Clopton

customer_reviews.title: Our house plants love it too!
customer_reviews.text: Love this filter! It was VERY easy to install (literally minutes) and has a surprisingly small footprint in the cabinet under our kitchen sink. Water quality is incredible, I honestly don't know how we used to drink the "filtered" water from our fridge, much less the actual tap water. One other unexpected benefit, our house plants have just exploded with growth since switching from our nasty chlorinated tap water. It also uses/wastes very little water in operation, a common criticism of RO systems. I've seen zero increase in our monthly usage since installing. (Actually our usage has gone down because of our beloved Rachio sprinkler system, but that's a gushing review for another day, lol).
customer_reviews.author: EricD

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, affordable and
customer_reviews.text: This system is amazing. We had it installed in a little over 2 hours.. the hardest part was removing the old fittings from the old system that we were replacing. We have well water and were tired of buying gallons of water every week. The replacement filters are reasonably priced (very important) and the water is crystal clear and tastes wonderful. My animals are drinking more now too because the water is so clean now! No more lugging 5 or 6 gallons home from the grocery store or worrying if we will run out.
customer_reviews.author: CaspianCove

customer_reviews.title: Keep leaking nont-stop
customer_reviews.text: The water system is very easy to install as most items are pre-assembled in the box. Only take me about 30 minutes to take off the old one and install the new one. However, the system keeps producing waste water 24-7 nonstop. Turning off the tank valve does not do anything to it. Turning off the water intake will stop waste water from producing (of course it will..). Bought a brand new ASO valve from APEC, the same manufacture and replaced it, no help to the situation at all. Tested my water pressure to be around 80-90, best pressure range for RO water systems. I would return the whole system and get something else instead
customer_reviews.author: Lin Lu

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, improved water taste, great value
customer_reviews.text: I've actually installed two of these - one in my father's house about a year ago, and one in my house 3 months ago. Installing my father's was difficult due to cabinet space constraints, but everything fit. Mine installed much easier despite having an under-sink water heater. The quality of the water is much improved - significantly better than the Brita pitcher I'd been using for the prior 2 years. It's also nice to not have to wait for filtered water; the flow will slow after a gallon or so but I don't generally dispense more than a gallon at a time. Filter life means much cheaper cost per year for water.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Flooded my house from leaking.
customer_reviews.text: The top of the tank leaks. You HAVE to put Teflon tape on it before you screw it together even though it doesn't say to. Flooded half my house.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Water tastes like plastic, even worse than tap water... don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Beth Liston

customer_reviews.title: Great for our horible water
customer_reviews.text: Our water was over 400 ppm of total solid. Total hardness was over 500 ppm and calcium hardness was over 300 ppm. Iron and copper were both over 3ppm. I test water for a living so I was able to test our water. After putting this system everything was below 1ppm and metals were at zero. Taste better, saves money from buying bottles of water. We has zero water filter and we would go through two a month. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Tania

customer_reviews.title: Helped us save on bottles!
customer_reviews.text: We were buying cases and cases of bottled water monthly and were looking for a more sustainable method. The water is SO fresh and delicious! You can tell the difference right away and now we just refill our water bottles and have saved a ton of money monthly! I installed it myself (with the help of YouTube) and it took me about 3 hours because of the odd size and angle of the space under our sink. We already had the space for an extra faucet so I didn’t need to drill a big hole in the sink like our best friend did, who also bought and self-installed this. Great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mi-RI El Khoury, Wedding Officiant

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: How does we live without this before? If wait we always lived in areas with great water quality. Just moved to Lexington, KY. the water is gross and florided. No thanks! We ordered this and it makes it so easy to drink water knowing it's also safe and clean. Plus the cost is about the same as we would have spent in fridge filters that don't do too much. I highly suggest this filter if you just need clean, safe, yummy drinking water at an affordable price. My best friend also bought one at the same time and we didn't even know we both got the same one.
customer_reviews.author: J.  Boling

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Have had it for 2 years. replaced filters at 1 year. no problem. Have saved 640 dollars on bottled water in the 2 years for an 80 dollar filter change. Have had no issues what-so-ever for 2 years. If it broke tomorrow I would get another one. It already paid for itself in money and convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, and no issues so far
customer_reviews.text: I've installed this filter twice now, once at work and once at home and I've had no issues with it, it's great. The TDS reduction is about 90% which is exactly what's specified in the manual. The faucet looks great, and it only requires a 1/2in hole in the sink so it's easy to drill. These come with a saddle adapter for the drain which I've never used, I don't trust them. Instead I bought some fittings at home depot and spliced the drain into the dishwasher waste port of my garbage disposal.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: From 300 ppm to just 20 ppm!
customer_reviews.text: Got this system because my town’s drinking water is constantly polluted with something. Latest discovery was that our manganese levels were 4x higher than federal EPA limits. So I bought and installed this system. My total water rating went from over 300+ ppm down to just 20 ppm (which is rated as ideal drinking water). System was easy to install. I’m fairly handy but it still took me about 2 hours because I took my time and didn’t want to mess up my plumbing. No more bottled water and plastic waste to deal with. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: This water filter is great
customer_reviews.text: We use this filter for tap water in our kitchen sink as well as for a humidifier. Previous to the filter we were using pitchers with filters and refilling them constantly. The humidifier was leaving a thin white film on everything, even with the filter installed that the manufacturer recommended. With this system in place, zero white film and great filtered water. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: It`s Working Great so far!!!
customer_reviews.text: It is saving us about $3.00 a day and will pay for it`s self in a little over 2 months as long as the filters don`t fail and allow the iron and sulfur taste to come through.. AT FIRST IT ALLOW SOME OF THE IRON TASTE TO COME THROUGH BUT SEEMS TO BE ALL RIGHT NOW, DON`T KNOW WHY. We are comparing it to a brand name filtered 17oz bottled water with about the same taste..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product but pex connections are a bit on the cheap side.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy installation with easy to follow instructions. Only issue I had was the pex couplers are a little cheap. 3-way pex coupler on the carbon filter leaked right out if the box. Tried to fix by removing and reinstalling, even replaced the plastic hose on it but still leaked. Ended up replacing with a new one from the local hardware store. $5 fix.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install with excellent instruction
customer_reviews.text: This one, in particular, I've owned at another house. These work really good and they are simple to install with the slip in water lines. It also comes with two different fittings for your cold waterside where you insert it downflow from the supply line. The many parts make it seem a bit complex at first but once you start connecting it up...Get the filters inside the canisters...and have plugged in all the lines using the color-coded directions... it becomes more simple to experience. Easy enough to install that even if someone did not ever do plumbing, they can do it without a hitch. And water taste super clean! I give it five stars! Something I don't do very often.
customer_reviews.author: bell57

customer_reviews.title: Great install but invest in a dual shut off valve!
customer_reviews.text: The previous owners of this house had a feed water adapter tapping into the cold water side just for the fridge. We have hard water where I am and there was a ton of crud and calcium build-up that the old valve started to leak. When I saw this kit came with the same adapter I spent the extra $20 on a dual shut-off valve that has a 1/4-in OD compression fitting. It is a SharkBite I was able to pick it up at my local hardware store (Part# SBDS123814Z). Much cleaner install and I also picked up a T for $2. There was enough line in this kit to run to the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: BoostinChick

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a pitcher based water filter for the last four years and I finally decided to pull the trigger on this system. After a week all I can say is that this has been amazing. I recommend getting the fridge/ice cube maker pack that allows you to split your output to a second source.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for old system.
customer_reviews.text: I had an old GE system that stopped working when the house pressure regulator broke, took out the RO system with it. I could not find a part for l, so replaced it with this system. All of the tubing and connections were different sizes (of course) but still only took about 30 minutes from start to finish to get up and running. Faucet is much better quality than the last one, and very happy with the 5 stage filter - last one was only 3. Stinks though that I had just replaced the RO membrane and charcoal filters on the GE system when it broke though!!120$ in the trash...
customer_reviews.author: Zim

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Great RO system! 2 complaints which are very , very minor. 1 being that mounting holes on the back of the metal bracket to hold it on the wall aren’t 16” apart so I ended up just mounting it to a cedar board, that was more than 16” in length, to mount to the wall and 2 being that I ended up buying more water line and push connectors since I have the system mounted in utility room in the basement and feeding the kitchen upstairs and wanted the connections to look a little “cleaner” vs a bunch of random bending connections. But the connector issues aren’t at all the sellers problem just my preference
customer_reviews.author: Redman

customer_reviews.title: Love this system!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Apec Water system 5 stage. After evaluating all of the systems I decided I liked all of the filters and the UV Light . With the virus we can't be too careful on our quality of water. My son installed it . I love it. The water tastes great!! I live in a county where the water is good but I want it better. I have a water softener in the basement and this system under my kitchen sink. Water taste great -can't wait to make coffee and tea with my new water!!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Steger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Ok other people downing product because you may need to make a couple trips to the store to get the correct connections. The kit comes with basically everything you need but the 2 connectors you need to connect it to your supply line and feed line if you are going to feed anything besides the faucet it comes with. Everything depends on your exact set up. Very good tasting water and not hard to install. I got it hooked up today and absolutely love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in every way
customer_reviews.text: So easy to install DIY and the product has held up like a champ. Our nasty Arizona water is perfect now after this unit. The filter replacement is like fitting legos together and they hold up very well. My water quality was still fine when I replaced the filters just because I felt I should by that point. They last forever compared to other units I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Ogrejelly

customer_reviews.title: Wastes 13 Gallons to Make 1 Drinkable Gallon
customer_reviews.text: It does make the water drinkable but wastes too much in the process for me to justify using it. It's constantly sucking in water and disposing of it.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Had to buy some extra 1/4 plastic water line and connectors...
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to install, good instructions. I had to run a long drain line so needed extra line and connectors. Also needed some wall anchors and a drill. I did replace an existing RO system so some lines were already there. Felt I had to replace my drain line because all the crappy water goes thru there and I am thinking it was getting clogged after 10-20 years prior use. I did sign up for the 6 month filter replacement program on here, makes it easier to remember to change them, there a little cheaper that way also.
customer_reviews.author: Bkan5

customer_reviews.title: Good-tasting water!
customer_reviews.text: I can finally drink my city water! We'd purchased a big filter but it never took away the taste. I had to purchase water in big jugs from the store, but then it didn't always taste good either. So my sister--who lives next door--purchased this APEC filtration system, and after I tasted her water, I bought mine right away. It fits perfectly underneath my tiny space under the sink. And it looks lovely! Now we have a papa and a mama faucet!
customer_reviews.author: MommyShopper

customer_reviews.title: Istallation Ease
customer_reviews.text: Quick connects are not as good as it should be . They leak . Be prepared to run to store and buy new ones . it took few trails and parts and 3 months before I could finish leak free installation R/O water quality is acceptable when new but how much it would last before giving bad water ? It appears Ok if you do not get leaky fittings .
customer_reviews.author: K.P.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I usually don’t write reviews unless I am very happy or very unpleased with a product. I was very unhappy with this product because for the money we paid for the water filter the water did not meet our expectation. We’ve bought cheaper filters before and the water tasted better than this filter water.
customer_reviews.author: karina

customer_reviews.title: Wish we bought it sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this. Since our fridge doesn’t have a water dispenser we had been using a Brita pitcher and I wish we had bought this a lot sooner. It’s honestly way more convenient then a fridge dispenser because it dispenses more water at a time. We installed it where our built in soap dispenser used to be (which was broken anyways). The spout fit perfectly in the hole. The spout can also be moved in a full circle which is nice. We’ve never run out of water and the taste of the water is really good. We lost some space under our sink, but we still have plenty of room for everything we need under there. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Zakk & Steph

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: 1st system stopped working so they had to send me a new one. New one works good though.
customer_reviews.author: Amreen K.

customer_reviews.title: Crisp and refreshing water!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t tell you how nice it is to have delicious water out of the faucet again. It’s crisp and light just like water should be! I live in Arizona and our water is BAD! I’m actually a little blown away at how well this filtration system works. Between the written directions sent with the system and videos on youtube, installation was a breeze! I think it took me under an hour. The system fits nicely under my sink and the faucet that came with it is classy. I’m incredibly happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: JKS

customer_reviews.title: Happy I replaced my old system
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Don't install during shelter in place unless you know what you're doing... plumber may not be available. Overall, the installation was pretty easy, but I was replacing another system , so some of the work was already done. Make sure you tighten those cartridges😂. The water tastes like... nothing! Just pure, refreshing liquid! The rate of flow at the super-easy-to-install, attractive faucet is quite adequate... it's not a tap, after all...but fills the coffee pot in a jif. Overall, I'm very impressed with the system, the quality of manufacture, taste, and value. I'm already drinking more water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product 👌
customer_reviews.text: My dad has had this for a few years now and after drinking it at his place we decided to buy and install one in our own house. It's easy to install and the change in the taste of the water is just amazing. ***Update March 14th 2020*** We switched out our filters and I can't believe how nasty city water is. Very happy with this water filtration system. Ive used the water from it for making baby bottles it has saved us alot of money by us not having to buy jugs of water. Adding pictures.
customer_reviews.author: JSlig

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We used to by bottled water for drinking, cooking and making coffee. No longer. The water is fantastic, better than bottled and also available whenever we need it. Installation was easy and the instructions were very clear and easy to follow. I had to sand down the center if washer when mounting to a stainless steel sink but that was a minor inconvenience. The instructions stated that the centering washer should be installed upside down but I realized that that would not keep the faucet centered. We are very happy with the final installation and the function. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S

customer_reviews.title: We love this thing
customer_reviews.text: My goodness, what an incredible product. The municipal water at our house is hard and tastes of chlorine. This system has transformed that water into the same tasting stuff I used to buy in a jug at the water store. It took me about two hours to install, and I had to purchase a metal bit to drill a hole in my kitchen sink. Make sure to tighten the filter caps TIGHT, as that was the only area where I had a small leak when first fired up. After tightening it, everything has been wonderful. This was a very affordable, major upgrade to our house.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Diehl

customer_reviews.title: Great R.O. system.
customer_reviews.text: My tap water total disolved solids went from the 130-200 range down to less than 10 with this R.O. I also found this company has cheaper filter replacement costs than others. Very simple installment that only requires installing an adapter on the supply line and drilling a hole before the sink drain loop seal for the reject line then installing the tap at your sink. I had a useless soap dispenser on my sink and just swapped that for the tap.
customer_reviews.author: Ollie42

customer_reviews.title: Why pay for all those plastic bottles and lug them home with the groceries, DIY!
customer_reviews.text: This 5 stage reverse osmosis water filtering system was purchased to replace a preexisting one after many years of service. The install was quite straight forward with many configurations to adapt to your plumbing. The spout was (still is) classy and functional. So far we've replaced the filters once. Probably about time for the second. You have the option for them to remind you when filters need replacing which is quite convenient. The instructions and users guides are more than adequate. Great value and way to reduce all those awful plastic bottles.
customer_reviews.author: gennaro f filice

customer_reviews.title: A lot cheaper than buying purified bottled water.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Philippines where our tap water gives me the runs. I used to buy bottled water for the family but when I tried to figure out how much it costs per year it came out to about $500 and the inconvenience of driving to the store to buy purified water was a hassle. This filter cost me less than $500 shipped to Philippines and I can use it year after year and the cost of the replacement filters makes it very cost effective. My family never had the runs since we started using this Apec water filter.
customer_reviews.author: A. Arceo

customer_reviews.title: My water tank gets maybe a half a gallon at most

This way the reservoir sits in the fridge and I get a cold water tap on the outside.

customer_reviews.title: R.O. is the way to Go!
customer_reviews.text: The water in my neighborhood is only good for bathing! I was purchasing bottled water often as the water from the faucet tastes terrible and is not good for human consumption. The R.O. filter removes all the bad elements that made the water taste bad. The water from the R.O. unit has no taste or smell; it is just refreshing like water should be. Don't throw your money away on bottled water, invest in and R.O. system for the health of your Family and Pets!

customer_reviews.title: Great product.

God Bless you.
customer_reviews.author: N8yMax

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend this brand to everyone.
customer_reviews.text: I install water equipment for a living, but I still chose this brand. It's a quality unit . My incoming water is anywhere from 260-54 tds , my product is at 4 tds. My family and I love this thing. I suggest flushing the first 5-15 gallons to get rid of the plastic smell. Also suggest replacing the filters every year with city water and at least twice a year with well water.
customer_reviews.author: nathan

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We have well water, and a few years ago we had some issues with a neighbor's septic leaking into our well (YUCK). Since then we've been using bottled water for drinking and cooking, which is obviously inconvenient and gets expensive. This filter system has been a Godsend. We borrowed a friend's electronic water tester. The particulate matter in the water straight from the faucet was 104 PPM, and the particulate matter from the filter was 30 PPM! I only wish we had bought this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Momofthe year

customer_reviews.title: I've been using this for about 3 years and love it
customer_reviews.text: It's been about 3 years with this system and it's still excellent. No problems whatsoever. Filters are easy to change, and the makers provide little wrenches and everything. The filters are also pretty inexpensive which makes this system an amazing value. It was an easy DIY install and you'll save a ton of money over renting or a no rated, no name brand from the hardware store. The water tastes great, and It was a very good buy. I highly recommend this system to everyone I know.
customer_reviews.author: spiketiegal

customer_reviews.title: how it works with city water
customer_reviews.text: Must say, this is an amazing system, you can taste the difference immediately! But after 30 days of usage in NYC, the system stopped working. I was amazed to see the sludge that accumulated on the filter that caused it to stop filling the tank. The product details indicate life of the fitlers 6 months, but that's not true in NY. only 30 days! that will become quite expensive. Does anyone know if the company would offer discounts for replacements based on this information? a shortler life span will make for frequent purchases of filters... maybe purchase by the case would offer discounts.
customer_reviews.author: abigal

customer_reviews.title: Great RO System!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this RO system. I have purchased two of these (two homes). Easy to install (great instructions) and I think good value for the money. I would say anyone purchasing one of these systems get an inline RO pump. The pump uses the water flow / pressure to work and it will do two things for you: 1. Increase the life of your RO filters and the filtering efficiency. 2. Decrease the water waste that goes to the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Mills

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I have City water and there’s a lot of chlorine in it. The installation is somewhat difficult but anyone can do it. There’s just a lot of steps. Once it was installed I could taste a noticeable difference. I then bought a tester and checked the water. This filter reduced my water from 223 parts per million to 7 parts per million. Definitely worth it to not be drinking contaminants.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and Value with standard filters and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: This about the 5th RO system I have installed over the years and the best so far. Two of them we replaced because they were too noisy. The last one had expensive proprietary filters and noisy. This one takes standard 10 inch filters. It also works without an airgap which also was source of noise and water sputtering out the hole. No problems yet with this one and easy to install. Also includes a nice filter wrench.
customer_reviews.author: sbhye

customer_reviews.title: Water tastes great.
customer_reviews.text: One thing to note, I like to keep my water cold in the fridge. I have found that the best way to do that is to use a glass bottle that is sealable. Regular pitchers, etc, will absorb the smells of the fridge and the water will smell...it is a strange phenomena, but after speaking with customer service and testing it out with sealed jars I confirmed that is the case.
customer_reviews.author: A. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: We moved and now have used this unit ROES-50 for 5 years.
customer_reviews.text: We change the filters as recommended. We went to long, I believe 14 months before changing the filter and the taste was worse before the change. We have a TDS meter. After changing we tested the water: our tap water measures 220 ppm. After the change of filters we were reading 4 ppm. I didn't however measure with the TDS meter before the filter change. Would highly recommend this unit. Easy to install. Easy filter changes.
customer_reviews.author: Kaela Murata

customer_reviews.title: Trouble shooting.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit in May 2019 and worked great until the August water bill came and it jumped for $35 a month to $55. Then started to look for leaks and found none anywhere. The I notice the sound of water running in the sink but the water wasn't on. I called the company and we went through some simple trouble shooting steps and determined the tank had become faulty. They suggested that I leave the water off and they would ship me a new tank. I just recently got the new tank but haven't yet installed. They were quick to provide help and most friendly. I would recommend this product and company.

Add an extra 4 gal tank to use as a spotfree car rinse.

I went with the 50 gpd unit because of my lower well pressure 50-60 psi, and it is more then enough for our family. I use it for ice cubes, cooking, dogs water and to off-set buying bottled water for drinking. The water tastes excellent.

Between family and friends we have five systems in different houses.
